channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023120891
item.description:
Report X-2023120891

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND O TH DOCK TO HAVE A WET OUTER BOX. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CAPS WAS LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS PLACED BY THE HAZMAT CAGE. THEN, PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023120901
item.description:
Report X-2023120901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA in the unload area from a trailer from another facility. Package was found on the ground with the topside of the package and side being wet. Action took place for cleanup at 6:30am DescribePack: Package failure cause was a repack with insufficient inner packaging and loose caps. Upon inspection QA found that there is one cardboard liner resting on top of bottles of liquid and no other packaging. Lids on plastic bottles were loose causing small spillage to occur and damage outer packaging. four of four alcohol bottles were leaking inside of package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was transferred into a hazardous waste bin lined with a hazardous bag. Other packages around area was inspected but no other damage was found to nearby packages

item.title: Report X-2023120924
item.description:
Report X-2023120924

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap came off one of the plastic jugs of degreaser causing the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

Report X-2023120885

  • City: WHITSETT

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found saturated and leaking. The box was moved into the hazmat cage and placed in the hazmat tote DescribePack: Upon inspection of the package 2 of the 1 gallon jugs lids were loose causing the leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in the hazmat tote with orientation arrows point in the correct direction

item.title: Report X-2023120945
item.description:
Report X-2023120945

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA 1 by the IC belt manger. He found it under the belt in a tote. There was a wet spot on the side of the package. After inspection, we found that 2 of the 4 bottles did leak out inside the package and contaminated all 4 bottles in the box. We put it in a lined salvage drum and moved it to the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: 2 of the lids were leaking out inside of this package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We moved this into a lined salvage drum and locked it in the Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023121011
item.description:
Report X-2023121011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Local train crew was delivering GBRX 705704 to destination facility when train crew observed liquid product running down the side of the car. Consignee told train crew to spot car on facility track. Consignee mounted tank car and found ethanol leaking from the manway. The cause of the leak was 3 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. Consignee tightened the bolts and the leak stopped.

item.title: Report X-2023121013
item.description:
Report X-2023121013

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 6 X 11 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE HEDRIX INDUSTRIAL STRENGTH CUSTOM COLOR SPRAY PAINT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023120548
item.description:
Report X-2023120548

  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO DOOR 162 WEARING PROPER PPE. THE PACKAGE WAS SITTING ON THE FLOOR IN A TOTE BOX. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND OXIDIXER RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
